revised_title: The Role of Partial Melting in the Mantle in the Evolution of Sedimentary Basins
tldr: This article explores the role of partial melting in the mantle during the formation of sedimentary basins. The authors propose that large stretching factors, greater than 3, control the transition from continental lithosphere stretching to oceanic accretion through the production of significant partial melting in the asthenosphere. This process significantly affects the law of subsidence and can lead to the formation of deep continental margin basins, such as the Armorican deep continental margin basin.
